stream_context.summary: Kaze live-models and block-outs Course 11, now re-themed from a volcano to Bowser’s oil-rig/air-ship facility. He experiments with spire-style “ocean mountains,” sketches mission flow (workers’ riot, crane, Bowser statue, power generator, red-coin sector, underwater 8-bit pipe), and discusses technical limits, naming conventions, and future asset work.

development_findings.summary: Course 11’s original volcano concept is scrapped; it is now an oil-rig that produces Bowser’s airships, demanding entirely new platform ideas and visuals.
development_findings.quote: Now that we switched to the oil-rig theming we need some new platform ideas; this is going to be a bit difficult to pull off.

development_findings.summary: Kaze outlines six missions: (1) ‘mess with the workers’ on floor level; (2) a strike in which Mario climbs a crane to behead a giant oil-spewing Bowser statue; (3) not yet detailed; (4) reach a power generator deep on the floor; (5) red-coins in a separate rig section; (6) an underwater 8-bit pipe area.
development_findings.quote: Mission one… you mess with everyone… mission two is where they are on a strike and you operate a crane to break a big Bowser statue… mission four is the power generator… mission six is the 8-bit pipe under the water.

development_findings.summary: A large Bowser statue will be carved from a central spire, with oil pouring from its mouth; during the strike Mario gains crane access to destroy it.
development_findings.quote: This looks cool… oil pouring out of its mouth… and with the crane you just behead him and get the star.

development_findings.summary: An air-ship / clown-blimp landing pad will occupy the top of the level, influencing layout size and shape.
development_findings.quote: If it’s a landing pad for a blimp… that’s the perfect place for the riot to happen.

development_findings.summary: Visual style experiments: slanted spires inspired by New Super Mario Bros backgrounds, using Blender geometry-nodes and vertex colors; high triangle counts acknowledged as an RSP risk.
development_findings.quote: This level is going to absolutely murder the triangles, so if we add cobbles… it might end up being too much.

development_findings.summary: Planned interactive assets: moving cranes, hooks, shipping containers, seesaw platforms, zip-lines, cannons, temporary fencing, concrete barriers, oil spills, jumping Podoboos.
Water recolored to a dark-blue ‘oily’ tone, with a wavy effect driven by math shaders.
development_findings.quote: I slightly changed the water color… made it less black and a little bit of a blue tone… How do you get the wavy effect? Mathematics.

development_findings.summary: Discussion of possible engine optimizations: decoding MP3s into RAM if a hypothetical 16 MB expansion existed; global coin count system not yet initializing.
development_findings.quote: If we had a 16 megabyte expansion pack… we could decode the MP3s during load time… There’s supposed to be a global coin count but it doesn’t initialize right now.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prefers rhymes or alliterations for every level name to make them memorable; current candidate is ‘Frantic Fleet Factory’.
context_findings.quote: All names in this game are like cool alliterations… Frantic Fleet Factory is the current name.

context_findings.summary: He often hyper-analyzes games, which can reduce his feeling of freedom while playing; he wonders if true freedom in games exists.
context_findings.quote: I know the steps I’ll take before I even play… Maybe freedom in games just doesn’t exist.

context_findings.summary: Personal note: Kaze and Zeina spent time outdoors making a sealed terrarium, indicating attempts at work-life balance.
context_findings.quote: Me and Zeina, we went out and we made a terrarium in a closed jar.

context_findings.summary: He is cautious about release timing; notes it’s risky to launch close to Nintendo’s Tears of the Kingdom because Nintendo targets ROM hacks after big releases.
context_findings.quote: Nintendo also has a habit of going after ROM hacks right after they release their own games, so that is a pretty ballsy move.

zeina.summary: End-game cutscene is on hold until Zeina finishes required animations.
zeina.quote: I still also need to do the end cut-scene, but I was waiting for the animations for Zeina first. They took a while.

zeina.summary: Shared personal downtime with Kaze creating a terrarium.

key_stories.title: Pivot to Oil-Rig Theme
key_stories.summary: Course 11 was originally a volcano but Kaze decides it clashes with the broader world. He re-imagines it as Bowser’s industrial oil-rig, triggering a complete asset overhaul.
key_stories.challenge: Volcano visuals no longer fit narrative tone.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed new industrial motifs, studied reference images (Rico Harbor, real rigs), and sketched initial platforms live on stream.
key_stories.outcome: Formal commitment to oil-rig concept, new mission list, and first 3D mock-ups.
key_stories.key_quote: Now that we switched to the oil-rig theming we need some new platform ideas; this is going to be a bit difficult to pull off.

key_stories.title: The Bowser Statue & Crane Strike
key_stories.summary: Kaze develops a set-piece where striking workers let Mario access a crane to decapitate a giant oil-spewing Bowser statue.
key_stories.challenge: Need a memorable narrative mechanic tied to level’s verticality.
key_stories.process: Places statue at center of map, plans lockout via Thwomps for mission 1, opens path during mission 2, brainstorms crane-climb tight platforming.
key_stories.outcome: Core of Mission 2 defined; visual of oil gushing from severed statue established.
key_stories.key_quote: We could have a crane climb mission… with the crane you just behead him and get the star.

key_stories.title: Iterating Course 1 After Feedback
key_stories.summary: Chat member Lilaa pushes Kaze to rethink Star 1. He adds a tree (or mushroom) and relocates the windmill to create vertical movement.
key_stories.challenge: Star path felt too short and linear.
key_stories.process: Live sketch of new route, discusses learning curve of plant platforms.
key_stories.outcome: Planned update to Course 1 level file.
key_stories.key_quote: Here we go again, but look… the star kind of just takes you around the whole level with a lot of vertical platforming.

open_questions.topic: Rationale behind discarding the volcano theme
open_questions.context: Kaze simply states they ‘switched’ but not why volcano was rejected.
questions: What specific narrative or gameplay issue made you abandon the volcano idea?
Did any technical constraints influence that pivot?

open_questions.context: He mentions Bowser’s minions going on strike but gives no story details.
questions: What motivates the strike and how is it communicated to the player?
Will there be dialogue or environmental storytelling?
How does this tie into Mario’s role—hero or agitator?

open_questions.context: Kaze worries about triangle counts and RSP load but doesn’t show a plan.
questions: What concrete techniques will you use to keep performance stable on real hardware?
Will you adopt dynamic LODs, culling tricks, or custom microcode?

open_questions.context: End-cutscene is stalled waiting for Zeina.
questions: What is the collaborative workflow between you and Zeina for animation reviews and integration?

open_questions.context: Kaze muses about decoding MP3s into RAM if 16 MB were available.
questions: Is a hardware expansion actually feasible for retail N64?
Would you ever target the 64DD or homebrew RAM carts to realize this idea?
How big is the current soundtrack in WAV form?

open_questions.context: Kaze says Rionu keeps pushing for translation.
questions: Has a localization pipeline been set up?
Will text be stored externally for mods?
How will you manage font and text memory limits?

open_questions.context: He notes Nintendo attacks hacks after major releases.
questions: Do you have a legal strategy or contingency plan for ‘Return to Yoshi’s Island’?
Will you delay release to avoid clashing with Nintendo’s schedule?
